title: Trains to and from New York delayed by up to 60 minutes
content:
September 17, 2015 15:55 EDT  
 
NEWARK, N.J. (AP) -- New Jersey Transit says trains into and out of New York are delayed by up to 60 minutes due to an Amtrak power problem in the tunnels under the Hudson River. 
 
NJ Transit says the power problem is causing staggered train travel through the tunnels. 
 
Cross-honoring is in effect with PATH and private bus carriers. 
 
This summer has been plagued by delays for trains in the tunnel because of Amtrak power problems.
